Description: Mould-made terracotta female figure plaque holding bird to breast. Feet lost. Covered in white coating or slip, probably originally painted. Cypriot brick-red (over-fired) marl clay fabric with abundant fine black (volicanic?) and white (limestone) inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ11 (probably)
Curator's comments: Parallel dated 500-450BC (British Museum GR1926,0410.2). Form of East Greek type, but appears to be of a Cypriot fabric. This figurine is labelled in pencil AΦ11 (however the final two characters could instead be read as 4), designating this as coming from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, from Gardner’s excavations in 1885-1886.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.335) (Phase 3)
